metadata.Title: CVE-2023-48795 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Prefix truncation attack on BPP: By manipulating sequence numbers duringthe handshake, an attacker can remove the initial messages on the securechannel without causing a MAC failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-48795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
openssh-server - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
openssh-sftp-server - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
openssh-tests - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
ssh - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

libssh-4 - 0.9.6-2ubuntu0.22.04.2
libssh-gcrypt-4 - 0.9.6-2ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

libssh2-1 - 1.10.0-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.9p1-3ubuntu0.5').
dropbear package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
golang-go.crypto package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
snapd package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
libssh package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.6-2ubuntu0.22.04.2').
libssh2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.0-3').
openssh-ssh1 package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
paramiko package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
putty package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
proftpd-dfsg package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
python-asyncssh package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
